words: It doesn't matter. He's way to strong for me anyway. I give up.

speaker: STAN

speaker: STAN
words: She wouldn't stop until she was NUMBER ONE!!!

speaker: KYLE
words: Uh... Stan...

speaker: STAN
words: Nancy Karrigan wouldn't settle for second best!!

speaker: KYLE
words: Stan...

speaker: STAN
words: She wouldn't quit until she brought home the gold!!

speaker: KYLE
words: Stan!!

speaker: STAN
words: What?!

words: Nancy Karrigan got the silver, dude. She came in second.

speaker: STAN
words: Really?

speaker: KYLE
words: Yeah, dude.

speaker: STAN
words: Oh... Never mind Jesus, Nancy Karrigan sucks.

speaker: STAN
words: You know... Somebody once said 'Don't try to be a great man, just be a man'.

speaker: JESUS
words: Who said that?

speaker: STAN
words: YOU did Jesus.

speaker: JESUS
words: You're right, Stan.

speaker: JESUS
words: Thank you, boys.

speaker: KYLE
words: Wow, did he say that in the bible?

speaker: STAN
words: No, I saw it on Star Trek.

speaker: KYLE
words: Hmmn.

speaker: SATAN
words: Come on you SISSY! Hit me! Hit me!

speaker: JESUS
words: Okay, pal, YOU ASKED FOR IT!!

words: AAAGHH!! YOU GOT ME!!!

speaker: REF
words: ONE! TWO! THREE! FOUR!

speaker: JIMBO
words: No way! He barely touched him!

speaker: REF
words: FIVE! SIX! SEVEN! EIGHT!

speaker: REF

speaker: STAN AND KYLE
words: OUR SAVIOR!!!!

speaker: ANNOUNCER
words: The winner by knockout and still undisputed ruler of your spiritual kingdom. Jesus Elllllll Saaaavior Christ.

words: Hey! He isn't hurt! He took a dive! He threw the fight!

speaker: JIMBO
words: Yeah.

speaker: SATAN
words: Fools!! You are all fools! Of course I took a dive! Don't you see -- who do you think was the ONE PERSON that bet on Jesus to win?

speaker: SATAN
words: ME you idiots!! And now I will take all your hard earned money and return to hell a MUCH RICHER Prince of Darkness and buy some real estate! Ha HA HA!!!

speaker: PRIEST MAXI
words: I don't believe this!

speaker: MR. GARRISON
words: Yeah, what a mean thing to do!

speaker: SATAN
words: Farewell fools!!

speaker: JIMBO
words: Man... That guy is a JERK!!

words: Jesus TOLD you guys not to bet on Satan!

speaker: MR. GARRISON
words: Boy, did we get screwed.

speaker: CHEF
words: Jesus, we're sorry... Can you ever forgive us?

speaker: JESUS
words: Aw, heck, do I have a choice?

speaker: JIMBO
words: Well Jesus, I definitely learned MY lesson. Never bet on evil, because when you do -- Ned, look! That's a rare duck billed platypus! It's comin' right for us!!!

speaker: KYLE
words: You bastard!!!

words: Well, goodbye guys, it was nice getting to know you.

words: I have to. My dad's always on the move.

speaker: STAN

speaker: STAN

words: Would you boys like some cheesy poofs?

words: (Walking away) Sure hon.

words: (Voice over) Here in the heart of Africa, children are dying. Not from disease or war... but from hunger.

words: Oh.

words: You see, here in the middle of Africa, food is extremely scarce --

words: Yeah, she's fatter than Cartman.

words: Mph rmph rm rpmh.

speaker: STAN
words: Oh.

words: I get to wear it first you guys!!

speaker: KYLE

speaker: MR. GARRISON
words: Children, children, to honor this special time of year, we'll be doing a canned food drive. Does anybody know what a canned food drive is?

speaker: MR. GARRISON
words: Yes, Eric?

speaker: CARTMAN
words: When they cut up a chick's stomach to get a baby out?

speaker: MR. GARRISON
words: ...No, that's a Caesarian section, Eric... But that's okay. Remember there are no stupid questions, just stupid people.

speaker: MR. GARRISON
words: A canned food drive is when we collect canned food for poor people who can't afford to eat on Thanksgiving.

speaker: STAN
words: (Pointing) You mean like Kenny?

speaker: MR. GARRISON
words: Exactly.

speaker: CARTMAN
words: (Raising his hand) Mr. Garrison, why do poor people always smell like sour milk?

speaker: MR. GARRISON
words: I don't know, Eric, they just do.

speaker: MR. GARRISON
words: Now children, I want each of you to bring in ONE CAN of food, and later the Mayor of South Park will divide it up amongst Kenny's family and other poor people.

speaker: CARTMAN
words: I'm not bringing in food for poor people. Screw them!

speaker: WENDY
words: Don't you want to help those who are less fortunate?

speaker: CARTMAN
words: Hey you guys, do you hear something? I think I hear the flower children calling.

words: This is the one time of year you're supposed to care about people who can't eat.

speaker: CARTMAN
words: Isn't it enough that I pay taxes?! What about the poor houses that I pay for?!

speaker: WENDY
words: Many would rather die than go to those places!

speaker: CARTMAN
words: Well then perhaps they should, and decrease the surplus population!

speaker: MR. GARRISON
words: Okay, kids, that's enough Dickens for one day. Let's get on with our lesson. Right Mr. Hat?

words: That's right Mr. Garrison, Englbert Humperdink was the first person on the moon, who was second?

speaker: CLYDE
words: AGHAGAGAH!!!!!

speaker: MR. GARRISON
words: What the hell is going on?!

speaker: GARRISON
words: Well... You don't see that everyday.

words: Okay, now once we have all the canned foods collected... We'll need some clever way to distribute them to the poor...

words: Ah... You're that insane genetic engineer from up on the hill, right?

words: (Skeptical) Uh-huhhhh....

words: You know, to provide food for the needy.

words: Well, something went wrong, and the turkeys broke free, and the worst part is... They're REALLY pissed off!

words: (Still Skeptical) Nnnaturally...

speaker: MAYOR
words: Oh do go on.

words: We have to stop them or they could destroy everything! Time is short!!

words: You were saying?

words: They act just like normal turkeys, except they're evil.

speaker: MAYOR
words: Oh, my...

speaker: MEPHESTO
words: Somehow I don't think you're taking me seriously.

speaker: MAYOR
words: Now why would you say that?

words: Damn!

words: Hey Mom!

words: Dude, let's bring him to school tomorrow!

words: Totally!

words: Oh!

speaker: MAN
words: Not as beautiful as --

speaker: STAN
words: This is a great way for you to experience America, Starvin' Marvin. This is what we call an 'All you can eat buffet'.

speaker: CARTMAN
words: Yeah, here you can eat all you want for only $6.99 That's why we all come here on Tuesday nights. Except for Kenny's family, 'cause to them $6.99 is two year's income.

speaker: CARTMAN
words: Why is YOUR family poor, Starvin' Marvin? Is your dad an alcoholic too?

speaker: CARTMAN
words: You see, Starvin Marvin, these are what we call APPETIZERS.

speaker: CARTMAN
words: This is what you eat before you eat... to make you more hungry.

speaker: CARTMAN
words: Oop! Food's here! That's it for the appetizers!

speaker: CARTMAN
words: No Starvin' Marvin that's my pot pie!

speaker: STAN
words: Cartman you butt pipe, this is the time of year you're supposed to share.

words: Oh yeah you're right. (to Marvin) Are you going to eat all of your peach cobbler? No you don't want all that. Why don't you share it with me... Let me just have some of that.

speaker: GARRISON
words: Children, children, I'm a little disappointed in your Thanksgiving spirit. Only a few cans have been donated to our canned food drive...

speaker: GARRISON
words: And can't we do a little better than -- (Reading the cans) Creamed corn, creamed corn and creamed corn?

speaker: GARRISON
words: Please bring in more diverse food children, or else Kenny's family is going to have a pretty 'corny' Thanksgiving.

words: Corny... Corny... Gravy... Corny Thanksgiving... Hoo!

words: Anyway, children, I understand a few of you have brought in something special for show and tell...

words: Okay, thank you very much. Yes, you can pick him up tonight. Bye now.

words: Now, boys I hope you've learned your lesson.

speaker: STAN

words: You can't care for this child!

words: Yes, but you don't actually get involved with the child's lives. You're supposed to just send money. And once in a while they write you a letter.

words: So why can't he live here now?

speaker: PRINCIPAL VICTORIA
words: I can't. I'm, ah, very busy. I send my $5 a month. See?

speaker: STAN
words: This sucks. Starvin' Marvin is our friend.

words: Oh well, back to the poor country with you.

words: You better watch what you say Cartman. You might be poor and hungry some day.

words: Oh, whoops.

words: Beans? Oh, oh, looks like we'll be at war with these Indians soon. Wait wait wait, here it comes... Oh, I crapped my pants.

words: (In the distance) HEY! SOMEBODY GET ME OUT OF HERE! THIS SUCKS!!

words: So please call and adopt a child today.

speaker: CARTMAN
words: Well SCREW YOU TOO!!

words: I tried to tell you but you didn't listen!!

speaker: TERRANCE
words: Oh, wait a second, Scott.

speaker: SCOTT
words: Sure... I mean No! You listen to me! If you want to save Canada, you'll meet me at Karl's Kraft Dinner Restaurant in half an hour.

speaker: CELINE DION
words: Oh, ugly Bob... I'm so confused. I love your personality, but you are so wretchedly ugly.

speaker: UGLY BOB
words: Maybe the baby will have your face instead of mine.

speaker: CELINE DION
words: We can only hope... I suppose we'll be okay, as long as you keep that bag on your head.

speaker: CELINE DION
words: What's this?!

speaker: SADDAM
words: Hey, there. My name's Saddam. I'm a big fan of Polo. I've been searching a long time for you Celine Dion.

speaker: UGLY BOB
words: Oh no you don't! She's my bitch!

speaker: SADDAM
words: Who are you?

speaker: UGLY BOB
words: I'm Bob. But my friends call me ugly Bob, because I have the features of a deformed burn victim.

speaker: SADDAM
words: Really? I thought all Canadians looked alike. Let me see...

speaker: SADDAM
words: Wow, I'm sorry, guy. You know, I could cure that face of yours.

speaker: UGLY BOB
words: You could?

speaker: SADDAM
words: Sure, I just need a favor. There's a Canadian football game tomorrow. The Ottawa Roughriders against the Vancouver Roughriders. It's at that game that I will officially turn the Canadian flag over to my Iranian one.

speaker: CELINE DION
words: What? Why?!

speaker: SADDAM
words: Hey, don't worry about that. Take a load off. Don't think about it. Look over here. All I need is for Celine Dion to sing our Iranian National Anthem at the game, to finalize my hostile takeover of Canada. What'dya say?

speaker: UGLY BOB
words: Did you say hostile takeover of Canada?

speaker: SADDAM
words: No, no, relax there, fella.

speaker: TERRANCE
words: Well, Scott said to meet him here, but now he's not showing up.

speaker: PHILLIP
words: Well, while we're waiting, why don't we search for treasure?

speaker: TERRANCE
words: Oh, good idea! Let's search for treasure!

speaker: SCOTT
words: What are you idiots doing?

speaker: TERRANCE
words: We're looking for treasure!

speaker: SCOTT
words: Is that some kind of metaphor for a kind of search that can't be described?

speaker: PHILLIP
words: No... We're searching for treasure.

speaker: SCOTT
words: Listen, I have an inside scoop. There's an Iraqi dictator who is quietly and slowly taking over Canada.

speaker: TERRANCE
words: Yes, you mean Saddam Smelly. We saw him on the tele.

speaker: SCOTT
words: Well, what are you two gonna do aboot it?

speaker: PHILLIP
words: What do you mean?

speaker: SCOTT
words: It's YOUR fault that he's here! YOU brought the Iraquis back with you on your plane when you rescued your kidnapped daughter.

speaker: PHILLIP
words: You mean WE are to blame?!

speaker: SCOTT
words: That's right, and now you must make amends. Tomorrow Saddam will try to finalize his takeover of Canada at the RoughridersRoughriders football game. All his soldiers will be there. It will be your only shot at wiping them all out. Here, take this.

speaker: PHILLIP
words: What is it?

speaker: SCOTT
words: It's a bomb. You must strap it to yourselves, go to the game, and sacrifice your lives to take out Saddam's minions.

speaker: TERRANCE
words: That sounds scary.

speaker: SCOTT
words: Well, you must do it, for Canada.

speaker: PHILLIP
words: For Canada, Terrance.

speaker: TERRANCE
words: For Canada, Phillip.

speaker: SCOTT
words: Yes... Yes... Terrance and Phillip. And when the dust has settled, Canada will be rid of both the Iraqis... AND your immature fart humor!

speaker: DRAMATIC MUSIC.
words: DRAMATIC MUSIC.

speaker: ACT III
words: ACT III

speaker: TERRANCE
words: Well, Phillip I am very sad that we have to die for Canada.

speaker: PHILLIP
words: Yes, this bomb will blow us both to smithereens. But we really have no choice. Only our deaths can bring Canada life.

speaker: PHILLIP
words: Wait a minute... Terrance that fart gives me pause...

speaker: TERRANCE
words: Why is that?

speaker: PHILLIP
words: That smelly Saddam Hussein, he uses germ and chemical warfare, does he not?

speaker: TERRANCE
words: Yes, apparently he does.

speaker: PHILLIP
words: Terrance, get the phone book! We must call every Canadian we can!

speaker: TERRANCE
words: Oh, Phillip, it sounds like you have an idea.

speaker: PHILLIP
words: I do Terrance (picking up the phone)

speaker: ANNOUNCER
words: And the Roughriders are really giving the Roughriders a run for their money. All else aside, I must say the Roughriders are simply out matched by these Roughriders.

speaker: ANNOUNCER
words: And that's going to take us to halftime. Be sure to stick around for the halftime show, Saddam and the Electric Iraqi's in a salute to hostile takeovers.

speaker: TERRANCE
words: Well, I guess it's time, old friend.

speaker: PHILLIP
words: Yes... Prepare the alert!

speaker: SADDAM
words: Hello to my Canadian friends. Everybody relax, take a rest, put your feet up, those dogs are barking.

speaker: SADDAM
words: You may have noticed some changes to your country. Don't worry about that, the changes will continue. I am here to announce once and for all --

speaker: SADDAM
words: THAT CANADA WILL NOW BE KNOWN AS NEW BAGHDAD! KOO LOOK KA LOOK!!

speaker: SADDAM
words: YOU WILL BOW DOWN TO ME AS YOUR RULER!! YOU WILL OBEY MY LAWS OR YOU WILL BE KILLED!!! HA HA HAAH HAA!!

speaker: SADDAM
words: AND NOW YOU WILL SING THE IRAQI NATIONAL ANTHEM -- OR YOU WILL BE STABBED IN HEAD!!!

speaker: CELINE DION
words: (sadly) Shtood makalek svtdot inka inka broost...

speaker: TERRANCE
words: Now, Phillip?

speaker: PHILLIP
words: Now, Terrance!!

speaker: SADDAM
words: What the hell is this?

speaker: CELINE DION
words: (still singing) barak a shtood, kalak a shtood...

speaker: SADDAM
words: (Choking) NOOOO!!!!

speaker: GUARD
words: They're using chemical warfare! How could they?!

speaker: TERRANCE
words: WE DID IT, PHILLIP! WE'VE DESTROYED THE TURKS!!

speaker: PHILLIP
words: OH GLORIOUS DAY!!

speaker: CELINE DION
words: Terrance! Terrance! You've saved Canada!

speaker: TERRANCE
words: Oh, it was all Phillip's idea!

speaker: UGLY BOB
words: God bless you, Phillip.

speaker: PHILLIP
words: Don't touch me, ugly Bob.

speaker: SCOTT
words: What the hell happened! You were supposed to be blown up!

speaker: PHILLIP
words: We came up with a better plan. You see Scott, after all your criticism it was farting that saved Canada!

speaker: SCOTT
words: Oh! That is SO JUVENILE!!!

speaker: TERRANCE
words: Hey Scott, do you like apples?

speaker: SCOTT
words: Of course.

speaker: TERRANCE
words: How do you like THEM apples?!

speaker: SCOTT
words: I HATE YOU TERRANCE AND PHILLIP!!!

speaker: TERRANCE
words: Oh, Celine Dion... You never finished that National Anthem.

speaker: CELINE DION
words: You're right Terrance, You're right...

speaker: ANGLE CARTMAN
words: ANGLE CARTMAN

speaker: NARRATOR
words: Who is Eric Cartman's father? At the end of tonight's episode, you WILL KNOW the answer!!

speaker: MEPHESTO
words: And now... To continue, the father is indeed someone in this room!

speaker: CARTMAN
words: Man, this feels like the longest minute of my life!

speaker: STAN
words: (Confused) Oh, hey Kenny...

speaker: MEPHESTO
words: Gentlemen, the father is...

speaker: MR. GARRISON
words: (In darkness) Hey, what the hell's going on?

speaker: JIMBO
words: It's a power outage!

speaker: CHEF
words: Is everybody okay? That sounded like a gunshot!

speaker: OFFICER BARBRADY
words: Oh my God! LOOK!!

speaker: KENNY
words: (Oh my God! They've killed Mephesto!) Mph mm Mrm! Mrphph mrph MrphMprhMrph!!

speaker: KYLE
words: You bastards!

speaker: MR. GARRISON
words: Mephesto's been shot!!

speaker: CHEF
words: Is he dead?!

speaker: JIMBO
words: Hey, this window is shot out, too! That means the killer was NOT somebody in this room!

speaker: MR. GARRISON
words: Then who was it?!

speaker: CARTMAN
words: Hey! Wait a minute! I didn't find out who my father was!

speaker: CHEF
words: Wait! He's still breathing! He's not dead!

speaker: CARTMAN
words: GOD DAMMIT! WHO'S MY FATHER?!

speaker: CHEF
words: We have to get him to the hospital!

speaker: CARTMAN
words: You've got to be kidding me!!!!

speaker: CHEF
words: Come on, children!

speaker: CARTMAN
words: Oh!

speaker: MR. BROVLOFSKI
words: Oh, that poor kid. It must be hell for him going through all this.

speaker: JIMBO
words: There's a murderer free in South Park! We have to find out who it is before they kill again!

speaker: MR. GARRISON
words: Yeah, God only knows who they'll kill next?

speaker: NARRATOR
words: Who will they kill next? Will it be Jimbo? (Slides again) Barbrady? The Denver Broncos...?

speaker: CARTMAN
words: Is he awake yet?

speaker: KYLE
words: He's bleeding pretty bad back here.

speaker: CHEF
words: Don't let him bleed on my Meredith Baxter Birney memorial towel.

speaker: KYLE
words: What's a Meredith Baxter Birney Memorial towel?

speaker: CHEF
words: I actually was with Meredith Baxter Birney in this very car, and afterwards, we used that towel to... Wait a minute, why am I telling you this?

speaker: STAN
words: Could you pull over so I can get out?

speaker: CHEF
words: What? We have to get to the hospital!

speaker: STAN
words: I have to get out first, I'm not gonna make it. I can't stand hospitals!

speaker: CHEF
words: Sorry, Stan. We just gotta drop Mephesto off, and then we can get out of there, alright?

speaker: KYLE
words: Man, it's really starting to snow, I hope they don't close the roads.

speaker: CARTMAN
words: They can't! Mephesto can't die!!!

speaker: KYLE
words: Maybe it's better you don't know who your father is, Cartman.

speaker: CARTMAN
words: No way dude, I can't stand to leave things unfinished. It's like when you hear the first part of that song "Come Sail Away" by Styx. If I hear the first part I have to finish it.

speaker: KYLE
words: Really?

speaker: CARTMAN
words: Yeah. I can't do anything until it's done.

speaker: KYLE
words: I'm sailingg awayyy...

speaker: CARTMAN
words: No! Don't!

speaker: KYLE
words: Set an open course for the Virgin Sea...

speaker: CARTMAN
words: -- Cause I've got to be free to carry on. Duh-dun (and so on)

speaker: KYLE
words: Woa, dude!

speaker: JIMBO
words: What are we going to do, Mayor? This killer is on the loose!!

speaker: MAYOR
words: Officer Barbrady... Let's pretend for one second that we had a competent law enforcer in this town. What would HE do?

speaker: BARBRADY
words: Hmm... That's a good question, Mayor... Let me get right on that with thinking.

speaker: DIRECTOR
words: Mayor! Mayor!

speaker: MAYOR
words: The press is here!

speaker: DIRECTOR
words: My name is Sid Greenfield. I'm the director from Los Angeles for 'America's Most Wanted'.

speaker: MAYOR
words: You certainly made it up here quickly.

speaker: DIRECTOR
words: We're desperate for stories. (Catching himself) AND this one is so compelling!

speaker: MAYOR
words: Really?

speaker: DIRECTOR
words: Sure! This story has everything! People... furniture... talking... It's a real American story.

speaker: BARBRADY
words: Hey, I thought of something! (Pause) Er... No wait, that's subtraction...

speaker: MAYOR
words: (Ignoring this) Mr. Director person, what exactly do you want to do?

speaker: JIMBO
words: Mayor, shouldn't we be focusing on --

speaker: MAYOR
words: Shh!

speaker: DIRECTOR
words: We just want to do a recreation of the story for our show. Then we'll flash a number on the screen that people can call if they have any information regarding the identity or location of the shooter. That's it. You win. We win. America wins.

speaker: MAYOR
words: Are you sure this wouldn't make our little town look dangerous?

speaker: DIRECTOR
words: Don't worry, Mayor, America's Most Wanted is not about violence, it's about family.

speaker: CAMERA GUY
words: It is?

speaker: MAYOR
words: Well, in that case, I guess it's okay.

speaker: DIRECTOR
words: Great! We'll get started with auditions immediately. What part should we cast first?

speaker: NARRATOR
words: WHO WILL THE DIRECTOR CAST FIRST?! WILL IT BE MR. GARRISON? OFFICER BARBRADY? CHEF...?

speaker: SOCIAL WORKER
words: Oh, well we can do that. This must be a very difficult time for you Mrs...

speaker: MS. CARTMAN
words: Cartman... Yes, It's such a hard decision. But I just don't feel I can raise a child in this screwy world.

speaker: SOCIAL WORKER
words: Yes, Ms. Cartman, if you don't feel fit to raise a child, an abortion probably is the answer. Do you know the actual time of conception?

speaker: MS. CARTMAN
words: About eight years ago.

speaker: SOCIAL WORKER
words: I see... So the fetus is...

speaker: MS. CARTMAN
words: Eight years old.

speaker: SOCIAL WORKER
words: Ms. Cartman, eight years old is a little late to be considering abortion.

speaker: MS. CARTMAN
words: Really?

speaker: SOCIAL WORKER
words: Yes, this is what we would refer to as the FORTIETH trimester.

speaker: MS. CARTMAN
words: But I just don't think I'm a fit mother.

speaker: SOCIAL WORKER
words: Well, but we prefer to abort babies a little earlier on. In fact, there's a law against abortions after the second trimester.

speaker: MS. CARTMAN
words: Well... I think you need to keep your laws off of my body.

speaker: SOCIAL WORKER
words: Hmmm... I'm afraid I can't help you, Ms. Cartman. If you want to change the law, you'll have to speak with your congressman.

speaker: MS. CARTMAN
words: (A little pissed) Well, then that's EXACTLY what I intend to do! Good day!

speaker: CHEF
words: Come on children, we gotta find a doctor!

speaker: STAN
words: I can't do it, dude!

speaker: KYLE
words: Come on, Stan. Hospitals aren't all that bad.

speaker: CARTMAN
words: Yeah, stop being a wuss.

speaker: CHEF
words: Doctor!

speaker: DOCTOR
words: One moment please! NURSE! I need twenty CCs of sodium pentothal, STAT!!

speaker: KYLE
words: Woa, dude, she doesn't have any arms!

speaker: DOCTOR
words: We're an equal opportunity employer here, son.

speaker: CHEF
words: Doctor, we've got a shot cracker outside!

speaker: DOCTOR
words: I'll be with you right after I inject this man with a long needle.

speaker: STAN
words: Oh man, I'm gonna be sick...

speaker: DOCTOR
words: There, there, young man. Medical science is nothing to be afraid of.

speaker: STAN
words: UGH!

speaker: NURSE GOODLY
words: Oooh, I think you're hitting the bone!!

speaker: STAN
words: (Turning blue) AAGHH!

speaker: DOCTOR
words: Yeah, I can hear the needle scraping against the bone inside!

speaker: DOCTOR
words: Oop, he's hemorrhaging!

speaker: DOCTOR
words: Oop! His head fell off!

speaker: STAN
words: I'm gettin' outta here!!!

speaker: KYLE
words: Stan!

speaker: DOCTOR
words: Well, some people just have a weak stomach.

speaker: INT. AUDITORIUM
words: INT. AUDITORIUM

speaker: MEPHESTO ACTOR
words: And the father of Eric Cartman is... BANG! Ugh!! Jimminy! I've been shot!!

speaker: DIRECTOR
words: Oh, thank you very much, we'll get back to you.

speaker: DIRECTOR
words: I think I've seen enough genetic engineers. Let's move on to the auditions for the part of... (Looking at papers) Mr... Garrison.

speaker: ASSISTANT DIRECTOR
words: Call the Mr. Garrison auditions!!

speaker: ACTOR
words: Boy, I sure hope I'm not Eric Cartman's father, Mr. Hat. (As Mr. Hat) You can say that again, Mr. Garrison.

speaker: DIRECTOR
words: Alright, not bad. Let's keep him on the top pile. Next!

speaker: MR. GARRISON
words: I sure hope that I am not Eric Cartman's father, Mr. Hat. (As Mr. Hat) You can say that again Mr. Garrison.

speaker: DIRECTOR
words: Thank you -- NEXT!

speaker: MR. GARRISON
words: What?

speaker: DIRECTOR
words: NEXT!

speaker: GOOD LOOKING ACTOR
words: I sure hope that I am not Eric Cartman's father Mr. Hat. (As Mr. Hat) You can say that again Mr. Garrison.

speaker: DIRECTOR
words: PERFECT! YOU GOT IT!!

speaker: DIRECTOR
words: Let's move on to the Chefs!

speaker: MS. CARTMAN
words: And so you see Congressman O'Riley, that's why I think abortion laws should be changed.

speaker: CONGRESSMAN
words: Well, all I know is that third trimester abortions are illegal. I don't really know anything about fortieth.

speaker: MS. CARTMAN
words: But the lady at Unplanned Parenthood said you were who I had to talk to about changing the law.

speaker: CONGRESSMAN
words: No, No, I think you gotta talk to the Governor about that stuff.

speaker: MS. CARTMAN
words: Oh dear.

speaker: DOCTOR
words: Well, this is about all I can do for him.

speaker: CARTMAN
words: Can't you get him to talk? I have to know who my father is!!

speaker: DOCTOR
words: Sorry, son, it might be a while.

speaker: CARTMAN
words: WAKE UP YOU SON OF A BITCH!!!!

speaker: CHEF
words: WOA!

speaker: DOCTOR
words: (Pulling him off) Now, son, that's not gonna do him any good. I'll let you know if there's a change in his condition.

speaker: CARTMAN
words: I CAN'T WAIT ANYMORE!! WHAT AM I SUPPOSED TO DO?!?!

speaker: KYLE
words: Hey, Cartman...

speaker: CARTMAN
words: What?

speaker: KYLE
words: I'mmmmm sailinngg aw --

speaker: CARTMAN
words: ...way set an open course on the Virgin Sea. (continues)

speaker: STAN
words: Okay, okay. Let's get out of here now.

speaker: KYLE
words: I don't know if that's gonna be too easy...

speaker: DOCTOR
words: My God, that's a hell of a storm.

speaker: STAN
words: Oh, weak...

speaker: DIRECTOR
words: God I hate mountains. This better not push back our shooting schedule.

speaker: DIRECTOR
words: Okay people, let's rehearse the reenactment from the top before we shoot it.

speaker: DIRECTOR
words: Who's that?

speaker: ASSISTANT
words: Oh that's T.V.'s Eric Roberts, we were able to get him to play the part of the little monkey guy.

speaker: DIRECTOR
words: Oooh, talk about washed up, huh? (To Eric, louder) Great to have you, Eric!

speaker: DIRECTOR
words: Here we go... And... ACTION!!

speaker: MEPHESTO ACTOR
words: I want to announce who the father is --

speaker: DIRECTOR
words: BANG!

speaker: MEPHESTO ACTOR
words: Oh! I've been shot!

speaker: BARBRADY ACTOR
words: Nobody move! I'm a law officer!

speaker: CHEF ACTOR
words: My God... I think he's gone into cardiac arrest.

speaker: BARBRADY ACTOR
words: You seem somewhat unnerved by this, Chef.

speaker: CHEF ACTOR
words: Are you accusing me, Barbrady? Because if you are, accuse! Don't hide behind your clever riddles.

speaker: BARBRADY ACTOR
words: Our differences must be set aside for now, Mr. Chef. I'm simply a man. A man trying to do my job.

speaker: OFFICER BARBRADY
words: Woa, this is a good movie!

speaker: CARTMAN
words: Sail away with meeee!!!!

speaker: STAN
words: Ohhh, dude, when can we get out of here?

speaker: JUGULAR WOMAN
words: Doctor! I can't focus!

speaker: DOCTOR
words: We're doing the best we can, ma'am. They've closed the pass and none of the other doctors can get through. For now it's just me and Nurse Goodly.

speaker: CHEF
words: Wait a second, they've closed the pass?

speaker: DOCTOR
words: Yes. I'm afraid we're critically understaffed. Unless we get help soon, all these people in here are completely fucked.

speaker: DOCTOR
words: (To them) Metaphorically speaking, that is.

speaker: CARTMAN
words: What about Mephesto?! Are you taking care of him?!

speaker: DOCTOR
words: He's on full life support and breathing fine. He shouldn't need any help... So long as the power doesn't go out.

speaker: DOCTOR
words: Whoof, who didn't see that coming a mile away, huh?

speaker: ACT II
words: ACT II

speaker: NARRATOR
words: Tonight, on America's Most Wanted, a shooter is on the loose in Colorado, and the residents are up in arms! Here's your host John Walsh.

speaker: JOHN WALSH
words: Good evening and welcome to America's Most Wanted. Tonight, terror invaded the small mountain community of South Park Colorado when Dr. Alphonse Mephesto was gunned down in his laboratory. America's Most Wanted has reconstructed this heinous crime in hopes that your calls can solve the case.

speaker: MEPHESTO ACTOR
words: I've been shot!!

speaker: MR. GARRISON ACTOR
words: My God, Mr. Hat, get some help.

speaker: MR. HAT ACTOR
words: (A tall, handsome actor) Right away, Mr. Garrison.

speaker: ERIC ROBERTS
words: No! Noo!! My lifetime partner and friend. Gone, taken away in the wink of an eye! Oh, fortune! How you mock me!

speaker: DIRECTOR
words: What the?! Eric Roberts is improving lines again!

speaker: CHEF ACTOR
words: I'm going to get the man to a hospital. Who will help me?

speaker: ERIC ROBERTS
words: This is not a world I want to live in! It is an angry world.

speaker: DIRECTOR
words: Dammit!!

speaker: DIRECTOR
words: What the hell is this?!

speaker: CAMERA GUY
words: We've lost the feed to L.A.!

speaker: JOHN WALSH
words: Uhh... We seem to have lost our linkup to the South Park crew... So I guess we'll be going to our feature movie, Who Framed Roger Rabbit.

speaker: ANNOUNCER
words: Who framed Roger Rabbit? Was it Jimbo? Mr. Garrison? Chef?

speaker: DIRECTOR
words: Somebody go see why we lost the hookup!

speaker: JIMBO
words: Holy smokes! That blizzard is gettin' crazy!

speaker: NURSE GOODLY
words: Don't panic, anybody. The power lines are down, but the backup generator is running fine.

speaker: DOCTOR
words: Nurse! I could use some help in here!

speaker: NURSE GOODLY
words: Coming!

speaker: CARTMAN
words: Lady, is Mephesto going to be okay?

speaker: NURSE GOODLY
words: Yes... For now. But I'm afraid the generator won't run for long. The batteries run out in half an hour. Time is very short.

speaker: DOCTOR
words: Nurse, PLEASE! I need another pair of HANDS in here!! (Beat) Oh... Sorry.

speaker: MS. CARTMAN
words: Don't you see, Govenor? I should have a right to have an abortion if I want one.

speaker: GOVENOR
words: Mmm... I don't know I might need some more convincing.

speaker: MS. CARTMAN
words: I mean, what right do I have bringing another child into this overpopulated world? Then again, I should have thought of that before having sex... Then again... Oh, I just don't know!

speaker: DOCTOR
words: Please, Mr. Chef, I have over a hundred people to tend to here, and only myself and Nurse Goodly.

speaker: CHEF
words: What do you want me to do?

speaker: DOCTOR
words: Do you know anything about surgery?

speaker: CHEF
words: I used to watch Quincy.

speaker: DOCTOR
words: WHAT?! Why the hell didn't you say so! Put on some scrubs!!

speaker: DOCTOR
words: Boys, I'm making you all honorary doctors! You can help us save these people's lives!

speaker: STAN
words: No way, dude!

speaker: JIMBO
words: Well, we're not going anywhere for a long time.

speaker: DIRECTOR
words: We're snowed in?

speaker: MAYOR
words: Yes... We're TRAPPED.

speaker: MR. GARRISON
words: Like sailors on a submarine.

speaker: MAYOR
words: My God, this is the worst storm I've ever seen.

speaker: ASSISTANT DIRECTOR
words: Ohh, I have to get out of here, I haven't eaten since breakfast.

speaker: OFFICER BARBRADY
words: Yeah, I'm gettin' hungry too.

speaker: JIMBO
words: I hope you all realize what we might be facing here...

speaker: JIMBO
words: Our only option might be to EAT EACH OTHER to stay alive!

speaker: DIRECTOR
words: Uhh... It's only been like four hours. Aren't you resorting to cannibalism a little quickly?

speaker: JIMBO
words: That's the law of the land, Mr. Director. I know it ain't pretty, but if a few of us might die so that the rest can stay alive so be it.

speaker: MAYOR
words: But how do we decide... who?

speaker: JIMBO
words: Well, we draw straws.

speaker: DIRECTOR
words: (Hysterical) Now wait a minute! We all had a big breakfast, can't you people go without eating for a little --

speaker: JIMBO
words: CALM DOWN, SOLDIER!! WE NEED EVERY PERSON HERE TO KEEP HIS HEAD!!

speaker: DIRECTOR
words: Well who the hell made you the boss anyway?!

speaker: ANNOUNCER
words: Who the hell made Jimbo Boss? Was it Barbrady? Chef? Mr. Garrison?

speaker: DOCTOR
words: This man's appendix has burst. I have no choice but to operate now, with our limited power. I need you all to be strong for me.

speaker: DOCTOR
words: Okay. Nurse Goodly will take care of anaesthesia. Chef, you'll act as her arms. Boys, you have to help with suction and bandages. Ready?

speaker: STAN
words: No.

speaker: DOCTOR
words: Okay, first I'll make an incision on the chest over the heart.

speaker: STAN
words: Oh, boy.

speaker: KYLE
words: Dude, you barfed into the incision!

speaker: CARTMAN
words: Sweet!

speaker: DOCTOR
words: (Jumping up and down) Suction!

speaker: CARTMAN
words: Hey, who's screwing with the lights?!

speaker: NARRATOR

speaker: DOCTOR

speaker: HERE.

speaker: NARRATOR
words: Terrance was born Terrance Herny Stoot, in the small Canadian village of Toronto. At a very early age his parents noticed an uncanny musical ability and decided to enroll him in the Canadian School for gifted babies.  It was here that he partnered up with Phillip Niles Argyle , a brash young baby from Montreal. Together, they performed musical acts that stunned Canadians everywhere. At the tender age of six, Terrance and Phillip were off to the United States to perform on the Ed Sullivan show . where American audiences would be exposed to Canadians for the first time.

speaker: ED SULLIVAN
words: And now, ladies and gentlemen, we have two adorable little boys from Canada. Please put your hands together for the music of young Terrance and Phillip.

speaker: NARRATOR
words: The Canadian act confused American audiences. But then something happened that would change Terrance and Phillip's act forever. It was the birth of Canadian comedy. Terrance and Phillip spent the next several years perfecting their art, and meetng some of America's most infuential people.

words: But it was in 1974, on the Sonny & Cher Show, that Terrance and Phillip finally started to mix their Canadian humor with deep political insight.

speaker: NARRATOR
words: As they entered their late teens, Terrance and Phillip were already starting to taste the sweet milk of success.  But the price of fame was looming, as Terrance and Phillip: Behind the Blow continues. The '70s and '80s were a good time for young Terrance and Phillip.  Their act on the Donny and Marie Show earned them a Nobel Peace Prize. They were oin the cover of every magazine.  And then in 1998, even a saturday morning cartoon was made, based on Terrance and Phillip.  Terrance and Phillip themselves supplied the voices.

speaker: NARRATOR
words: The cartoon was such a huge success that it started to breed confusion over whether Terrance and Phillip were animated characters or real people. And so, in 1998,  the comedy team started work on what they thought would be their greatest achievement: A made-for-TV movie written by and starring Terrance and Phillip, called "Not Without My Anus."  It was their biggest project to date. But it had the misfortune of being scheduled on a night when a different and more pupolar show, the John Schneider Variety Hour , was supposed to air. When fans tuned in to see John Schneider and instead were treated to the Canadian made-for-TV movie , they were enraged, bewildered, and scared.  The fans revolted and burned down the network, killing six television producers and wounding twelve others.  The hatred of Terrance and Phillip had begun. Terrance fell into a deep depression and started abusing wod pulp  Phillip beat up an angry six-year-old fan and was sued for six million dollars. It was the first time the duo tasted failure , and it nearly killed them both.

speaker: NARRATOR
words: After years of depression and suicide attempts, Terrance and Phillip finally decided to get together  for one last film:  the 1999 hit, Asses of Fire. It was one of the highest-grossing films of the summer.  And though the film also started the Canadian-American War of 1999 , in which eight million people lost their lives, the film was conisdered a great success.  After almost being executed by the Aemrican government , Terrance and Phillip were eventually returned to Canada , where they were touted as heroes.  They have been to hell and back, through the very best and the very worst of times, together, but they had seen it through.  And so ends Terrance and Phillip, Behind the Blow.

speaker: FATHER MAXI
words: It is sometimes hard, in times like these, to understand God's way. Why would he allow nine innocent people to be run down in the prime of their lives by a senior citizen who, perhaps, shouldn't be driving? It is then that we must understand, God's sense of humor is very different from our own. He does not laugh at the simple "man walks into a bar" joke. No, God needs complex irony and subtle farcical twists that seem macabre to you and me. All that we can hope for is that God got his good laugh and a tragedy such as this will never happen again.

This latest tragedy comes only two days after the accident in Deer Creek, where three construction workers and a bulldozer  were run down by senior citizen Paul Thom , who was trying to find Country Kitchen Buffet. Public outcry is forcing the DMV to consider suspending the licenses of all seniors over seventy, though no decision has yet to be made.

speaker: ANNOUNCER
words: In our last episode the four ninjas did battle with Professor Chaos, bringer of destruction and doom. It was during that great battle that ninja master Kenny threw his star into Professor Chaos' eye. Now the ninjas were in serious trouble, because their parents might find out they had weapons if Professor Chaos told on them. While trying to get Professor Chaos some aid at the veterinarian's office, the four ninjas ran into Craig and his three friends. They challenged the four ninjas to fight, and the legendary battle of Tokutawa began. It was during this battle that Professor Chaos escaped , and so the four ninjas were forced to join forces with Craig and his friends to find Professor Chaos, or else they would all be grounded.
